intro: Bolanthus frankenioides var. fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy species in xerophytic environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening in arid landscapes.
